name: Teresa Thigpen
text: This is 1 of my favorite pizza places...Always Great!!!!

name: Jennifer Pittore
text:
I love the idea of create your own pizza.
They have all the toppings.  I've been to Pizza Fire in Ohio which is similar.  You  need to enjoy thin crust pizza or you should pass. …More

name: Thom Thomas
text: It's okay. Think Chipotle but with flat bread pizzas. A pizza and a soft drink cost me $15 - so kinda pricey. The food was good, but I didn't like the seating. Felt way too fast food or food court in the mall-like. Might be a decent spot to do a happy hour at.

name: Teresa Thigpen
text: Pizza was ok...

name: Jerreca Saulsberry
text: Chan and Makalia always offer great service when I go into the restaurant! Chan always has a smile and checks in while you are eating! The ingredients  are always fresh and hot! Pizza Rev is one of my biweekly stops! For quick and great service stop here!

name: Crazy Washburns'
text: Fresh salad with great flavor.  Pizza filled with toppings and right amount of sauce! Oreo dessert pizza.. yep it was about as great as the service.  Thanks for the experience!

name: Makeup_by_Jess
text: Great place! Love getting to try all the local and seasonal beers on tap at the beer bar while we enjoy our individual pizzas. Family friendly atmosphere and Sham and Keshia are amazing!! So friendly and helpful!

name: Reuben Glass
text: I had a great experience at the poplar ave location. Shambrica was very welcoming and had excellent customer service. And the pizza tasted great!

name: Amy Reynolds
text: If you like cold pizza fresh out of the oven then this is the place for you!! I’ve been here several times and the poplar location seems to be declining. I also witnessed a young lady cutting the burnt half of someone’s pizza off before serving.

name: Jeffrey Norris
text: Ok so this is a chain. I'm not a fan of chains.   However, the pizza is pretty good if you get one without red sauce.   They have you pick your toppings like subway.   Its quick. And this location has a really cool self pour craft beer station.

name: Becca Elisha-Marie
text: Good food not gonna lie. But service wasn't that great. They charged for a large drink even though the kids meal came with a drink and we wanted chocolate milk as the kids drink, but they didn't give it to us.

name: Lisa Wherry
text: When I first notice this place I thought it was just another pizza place ( like do we need another one). But it was much more. I was very special that the menu says u pay for the dough only n the ingredients are free. I finally had a say so …More

name: Bryan Miller
text: The manager here, Sham, is awesome, amazing, and wonderful! Such a great manager, genuine great mood and such a good personal vibe from her!! Pizza was AMAZING! They also have an amazing beer selection with two wines, I think a Chardonnay …More

name: Kristen Bortz
text: Nice staff, neat beer wall with various choices including wine...(red and white) local brews. Tasty pizzas ... Pick your open toppings or get an in house special. Moderate prices. Not cheap, not expensive. Must visit if you're in Germantown and haven't tried before. Kid friendly, non smoking, out door seats available.

name: Chris
text: This is a create your own pizza place and it is very good. They also serve beer here in a unique pour your own way. Which is great because you can taste the different beers , many of which are local.

name: mark taylor
text: Good pizza.  Lots of TVs.  Good service. Convenient location

name: Gina Horne
text: Pizza was very delicious. Of all the build your own pizza restaurants, this one is the best. Their topping options are the most unique and the crust options are a plus. Vegetarian can get veggie sausage and other pizza restaurants do not offer a meat substitute for vegetarians.

name: quitta wesley
text: Second time coming pizza still great hospitality,services and courteous is great!!! Shambrice is a excellence leader, she did what it take to get the job done and a orderly fashion...

name: isha gupta
text: Nice thin crust pizza. Good service. Good for quick bite!

name: Abby McClain
text: my pizza was delicious and i even wanted a second one! it was cooked very fast and it was so good. i will definitely be coming back here!!!

name: Caroline Lutey
text: Cold pizza again. Like the dough itself was cooked, but all of my toppings were cold. This has happened before and I thought that maybe it was just an off day or something. I'm now thinking the employees don't know how to cook pizzas …More

name: Jordan Geiger
text: Service is always fast! My food taste delicious, I love the sauces they have. This has become my lunch break on Fridays for sure!

name: Vic Porter
text: Pretty quick to compete. Great quality and lots of options .

name: Pamela Koontz
text: Service was good, beer and wine wall is an awesome choice, but the quality of the pizza was bland. Needs more flavorful sauce. I had the spicy sauce and it was still bland, however I did enjoy the topping options and choice of thin crust. It's a bit pricy for what it is. Overall I'm not sure I'll be back.

name: Stephen Krassick
text: Food is good service usually sucks. I'm glad to see the owner reads reviews. To be more specific. …More

name: Christy Dunn
text: Awesome until they closed down without notice

name: Seth Holland
text: This place was great!  What a great idea.  The pizza was great, and so was the beer selection.  A pour your own beer place?  Yes, please.  My wife and I will definitely be coming back here.  Not only did we get to speak with the owner, but …More

name: 20th_century_comics
text: SO GOOD. The pre-designed pizzas on the menu are great, but it's so fun to design your own. Fast and friendly service. The self serve beer wall is awesome and it even has wines on tap! Go to this place.

name: pigalis h22a cb7
text: I will never eat at a place  that charges over 2$ for water ridiculous

name: Matt Shapard
text: Toppings plopped on, 80% of the drink machine was out, too much black stuff on the bottom of 2 pizzas.  Workers whispered and weren't very friendly or inviting.  Shocked to see this place has now closed....not really.

name: Andy Chiuppi
text: First time at a PizzaRev. Out of crust, out of most beers, and bad customer service. Need I say more. Save your money and time and go to Pyro's instead.

name: Scott Bosarge
text: The concept is getting a little crowded with other similar pizza places. However the pizza here was very good with interesting toppings and ingredients. Beer is served from a self-serv tap system that is very innovative and cool.

name: Elaine Plybon
text: Great pizza, fun experience with the self-service beer and wine. Extremely friendly and helpful staff! Wish we had one in the Dallas area!

name: Iroquois Pliskin
text: Great spot, yum pizza and boy is it busy around lunch.  Watch out for bubbles, but they're not usually a problem.

name: Emily Watkins
text: The first thing I noticed about this place is that it is a little on the pricier side. One person maybe can get out of there right at $10, but if you decide to do double dough or gluten free, it goes up from there. It's pretty much in the …More

name: Cassandra Becton
text:
Our experience was great !!
Kesha and Sham we're awesome!!
We will definitely be coming back !!

name: Stephanie Haeger
text: The place echoes. Hard to have a conversation. Not bad

name: Jimmy Arnold
text: Tasty, pretty fresh ingredients,  inexpensive.   A good deal.

name: Michael Howard
text: We hace a group that goes there about 9:15pm on Wednesdays.  They don't close until 10pm.  Have been there and they had the door locked at 9:15.  Last night they locked the door at 9:49pm.  If you are open until 10pm keep your door open …More

name: Bobby Mooring
text: Half thin crust veggie pizza / salad combo made a great lunch. The salad was huge.

name: Don Cole
text: The pizza was pretty good, but the staff acted pretty put out that you bothered them with the order. I had one and a half beers and my wife had a glass of wine. Total charge for a beer and a half and a glass of wine was ........Wait for …More

name: Ghong Yang
text: The pizza toppings could have been crispier, but a good pizza overall for the speed and price

name: Jeremy Pohlman
text: I love this place.  Cheap build your own pizza and a really cool pour your own beer wall!

name: LaShundra Garner
text: It was my first time. My kids enjoyed the pizza

name: Mark Winburne
text: Thin-crust pizza made to order with as many fresh ingredients as you want brought to your table in just a few minutes. Just one thing: the pizza cools off pretty quickly.

name: Rosana Torredondo
text: pizza is really good and lots of craft beer to choose from! will definitely go back!

name: Max Simons
text: Great pizza, very tasty, absolutely outstanding customer service and the craft beer wall is worth the trip on its own. Highly recommend a visit.

name: Shawn Rees
text: Great experience for our first time dining in Memphis. Will definitely go back next year

name: Lisa Smith
text: Good food, I'd say comparable to Pyros (which I guess is the point). But way overpriced for what it is.

name: shawon jones
text: The Pizza Here Is ..........Not Tasteful What So Ever , The Dessert Pizza Is Pretty Good But That's About The Only Thing Going For This Place . I Think You All Need A Better Way If Deliverying pizzas besides screaming out names. And when I …More

name: Jennifer Black
text: This is a great place to hang out and drink beer. But the pizza is disgusting. Memphis literally has the worst pizza restaurants in America but no one will openly talk about it.

name: Kisten Lenoir
text:
The employees were very kind and informative considering it was my 1st visit.
The food was YUMM & I liked the venue

name: Jeff York
text:
They get 1 star because 0 wasn't an option.

Start with loud music and mumbling employees in a place where you have to …More

text: Good food, nice location, great self-serve beer and wine bar. "Build your own" pizza.

text: Awesome food, comfortable atmosphere, Great beer selections.

text: Great concept and excellent thin crust pizza. Would eat here again for sure.

text: Great salads and love the thin crust pizza!

name: David Moore
text: Love having lunch here. Nice to see a staff with customer service skills.

name: Kerstin atlantic
text: Gluten-free and natural ingredients.  Pizza is awesome tasting.  Love it! !!

name: Charlie Folsom
text: great pizzas & was even better when I ate leftovers for lunch!

name: Brian Menius
text: I waited until several months after their opening with the hope that they would hit a stride and work the line quickly, but that doesn't seem to be the case. This is our third time here, and each time it's taken upwards of 20 minutes to get …More

name: Brent Smoyer
text: The beer wall fun. The pizza is delicious.

name: Jason Ridenour
text: If you are looking for a quick bite, and you have a taste for pizza, this place isn't a bad option. There appears to be frequent turnover with staff, and there are some questionable food quality issues (tasteless chicken, frozen salad, …More

name: Jerry Johnson
text: Friendly service & great food

name: Kimberly Holley
text: Meh. Pizza flavor was ok, but undercooked and soupy. Staff was mostly nice, although I could do without a ten minute monologue of what  a 'rewards program' is. Salad was a little wilty and the balsamic vinaigrette was as generic as it gets. Overall, for the exact same concept, I'd prefer Pyros.

name: Justin Barnes
text: Good pizza in a pro-casual atmosphere that is essentially a Subway but with pizza.

name: Richard Heath
text: Good pizza, good beer. Servers didn't know menu - ordered one of their special pizza and had to tell him what was on it.
